result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- AMENDED

$500 bond on file.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least FOUR times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

Defendant shall contact Kara Rheingans, Case Manager - Behavioral Health at 715-716-0920 within 24 hours. Ms. Rheingans shall conduct an intake screening to determine appropriateness for inclusion in programming offered by Behavioral Health. If you are screened in for services, you shall participate in programming as recommended. Failure to contact Ms. Rheingans or participate may be considered a violation of your bond.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, R.M.M.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant not to have any conversations with victim or friend about this event. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

4:15 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joshua Wesley Pletan in court without an attorney.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pam W. from Victim Witness along with Kellie S. from JSC are also here in person.  Court reviews file and conditions that were ordered on Wednesday by Judge Vlack and CBS.  DE has gotten SCRAM unit and has had a conversation with Ms. Rheingans but learned she will be out of office through next week.  Court questions Kellie regarding contact and SCRAM.  Kellie confirms DE did sign up for SCRAM.  Phil from JSC is now here in person.  Court updates Phil on file. Phil makes statements. Court modifies bond to NAC. Adjourned at 4:24 PM. bph
Filed by DE. kma

records.addlTxt: Victim's Petition for Bond Modification. No objection by DA.  gll   to EFV 8/25

$500 bond on file.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least FOUR times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

Defendant shall contact Kara Rheingans, Case Manager - Behavioral Health at 715-716-0920 within 24 hours. Ms. Rheingans shall conduct an intake screening to determine appropriateness for inclusion in programming offered by Behavioral Health. If you are screened in for services, you shall participate in programming as recommended. Failure to contact Ms. Rheingans or participate may be considered a violation of your bond.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, R.M.M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:08 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Joshua Wesley Pletan in court.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared with Pam of VW. Court reviews file. DE states he completed PFAC and filed with the Clerk's office. Court reviews letter filed by Victim. No objection to amend to no abusive contact by the State. DE states he has a meeting with Atty Bosworth on Friday. Court amends bond- if DE meets with Ms. Rheingans and gets fitted with a SCRAM, Court will amend bond to no abusive contact. Court authorized another branch to modify bond. Court sets further STC to check on status of counsel. Adjourned at 3:21 PM.  gll
